posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
First of all, congrats for your first official build Stag!

Spread looks good, AB & Damage look good and he is tough, but let's add some constructive criticism here.

a) I don't see knockdown and this is the most essential (even from blind fight) melee feat. For sure, some people might not use it but when you make a build, you always have to propose the best possible thing, yourself use it or not. So, if i might suggest, replace those power attack/ cleave feats with knockdown and it's improved version. Now we, professional knockdown spammers can make mages/ thieves our bitches again!

b) Take defensive feats in order of importance. First expertise (biggest bonus) then dodge/ mobillity and the rest.

c) Change your spread around and delay weapon master for dwarven defender. Reason being that dwarven defender has two good saves so, when you take more dwarven defender pre-epics you gain better saving throws for free. Something like 8/ 10/ 2 will work fine for example. It's not that you are weak without weapon master anyway, so you can surely afford to wait a bit for it.

d) Do not cheat yourself! Your damage is 1d10 +24 (you forgot to add ews to your calculations) ;-)

All in all, a terrifyingly powerful dwarf, good job!
